name: The Typing of The Dead: Overkill
description: Typing of the dead: Overkill fuses the horror and comedy of the legendary House of the Dead series with unique typing mechanics in order to deliver a truly original gaming experience! This gruesome shooter puts you in the middle of a mutant outbreak in Bayou county.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / Windows 8 Processor: 2.0 GHz Dual Core processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 6450, NVIDIA GeForce GT 220 or Intel Integrated Graphics HD 3000 DirectX: Version 10 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / Windows 8 Processor: 2.0 GHz Dual Core processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 6450, NVIDIA GeForce GT 220 or Intel Integrated Graphics HD 3000 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 10 GB available space

reviews.review_text: The story is ludricous. The plot and dialogue feel as though they were ripped straight from the lowest budget 70's B-movie ever imagined. And yet this game is entertaining. The novelty of typing out words to kill zombies is definitely refreshing (and the game even gives you the option to play the game as a regular mouse and keyboard port of an arcade shooter).  All in all, a lot of fun for the price. Even better if you can pick it up on sale.

The next typing educational software to be introduced to schools ladies and gentlemen! Joke joke, not enough gore to reach the blood on screen requirements they have.   This game is really fun and at the same time extremely corny. The over the top humor is going to be a huge hit or miss on people but thats not going to make people drop the deal to get this game.   I am not sure if this game is something that could teach you how to type fast since it seems more like a testament to how fast you can already type because of previous courses you took or just pure experience. If you want to get this game on the whole idea of learning to type you might want to play this in sessions like 30 minutes to 1 hour a day and not overplay it so that it has more long term value and feels less reptitive to you. If your a keyboard warrior and just want to enjoy mowing down zombies with your skills then why not?   You never know though, I am sure this has helped some people out.
Less than an hour into this game and I am so disgusted......    with my typing abilities.

House Of The Dead: Overkill, it's not just good, it's ♥♥♥♥ing delicious!  Critics said 'It's ♥♥♥♥ing good'  Other critics said 'It's mother♥♥♥♥ing good'  A street corner ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ said 'I would suck that guy's ♥♥♥♥!'  A toothless crack ♥♥♥♥♥ said 'Give me a chicken dinner!'  House Of The Dead: Overkill, ♥♥♥♥ed up genius!

Do you want something different in your games? If so then pay attention to this typing game which might save your ♥♥♥ from zombies errr I mean mutants.  Pros:  1. It's a very hard game if your typing on the keyboard (If you have fast fingers without making errors then you might find this game easy)  2. Lots Of Cheesy Horror In A Good Way  3. I personally thought the dialogue in this game was hilarious to listen to  4. Interesting Bosses to kill  5. You can switch to The House Of The Dead any time in the menu of the game if your sick of typing  6. I like the mix of playing as both a male & a female  7. Lots of swearing  8. Decent Voice Acting  9. Lots of collectibles to gain  10. Lots of replayability  11. Some of the songs in this game are catchy to listen to (There's also a few funny songs)  12. Easy controls  Cons:  1. There are only 9 levels in this game  Overall If you want to learn how to type on a keyboard then this game will give you a lesson (It also improves spelling)

beacon's sometimes-tumultuous direction is a bold affirmation of her artistic vision, unshakable in the face of the gaming press' blistering response to her messy 2007 divorce with dr. brain. you don't have to call it a comeback, just call it the most surprising typing simulator of 2013. 7/10

The Typing of the Dead: Overkill is a violent, brain splattering typing game that has you wielding a keyboard instead of a gun to stop waves of zombies. The light gun games are fun and this is a novel twist, but you really have to be up on your typing to play them. If you find it frustrating when playing a PC game and keyboard quick time events pop up, you won’t be good at this game. You have to be able to type, hit random keys and keep an eye on the screen the whole time. If you played the last one, this one amps up the silly factor with over the top cussing and over the top grindhouse style scenes that contain sex and violence.  Check out the video review of this title on youtube, in Steam Shots EP125
I nominate SEGA's  The Typing of The Dead: Overkill  for  The “Game Within A Game” Award  category in The Steam Awards 2016!

The Typing of The Dead:Overkill   The Typing of The Dead series, probably the only games to have 'Typing' 'Educational' and 'Zombies' in the one sentence.   PROS   + For the Keyboard Warrior  Everyone loves a good typing/educational game right? no? Well not everyone is a huge fan of educational games. But this game puts a video game cliche on it and makes it about killing zombies! You love killing zombies don't you?  Even if you're not a huge fan of a zombie game this one can certainly improve your speed AND accuracy as a typer, trust me, nothing gets your fingers typing faster if a zombie is running towards you.  As one of my friends said 'If you can type fast, you'll love this game'  + T-the story?  Why, why did I care for the story? This game is basically a mod of House of The Dead but instead you use your keyboard to kill the zombies. But for some reason, I really enjoyed the characters and how they reacted with eachother.  + Not a fan of the typing aspect? No problem!  I only tried for the first level of this because I only really bought this game for the typing, but if you don't enjoy the typing aspect you can always try out the PS3 port of House of The Dead where it becomes an on-rails shooter instead.   CONS   - Short, Like. Really short.  So this game has a total average playtime of 4 hours with 7 hours if you're a completionist. That's not that great, while I did enjoy the short and sweet storyline, that doesn't mean I don't want more action. Even so, you can team up with a friend for multiplayer or try out the minigames.  - Somewhat, easy.  So I suck at Video Games and according to my friend, I even suck at typing. but even at the normal difficulty I was able to plow through zombie with easy. I guess that's why hardcore mode exists. (Seriously though, hardcore mode 2hard4me.)  - Broken mechanics?  As I was playing I started to notice quite a few bugs. for one theres a lot of the sound effects and dialogue being cut for no reason, it wasn't even in the middle of a cutscene. Also I noticed while typing to kill you didn't actually need to press the space key when it was two words, I looked over it and still pressed space but that does feel a bit cheap.   Final Notes and Score   -This is probably one of the best typing games out there so if you're looking to improve and have some fun, I suggest purchasing this.  -I haven't tried it, but the DLC looks interesting aswell, making you type like Shakespeare should up the difficulty right?  -If you find this game great, I suggest looking into the older Typing of The Dead series, there really good and even harder.  -Before you go, I leave you with   this masterpiece     Final Score: 9   SPOILERS AHEAD  -  I found the last boss great, I wish they had more gimmicks like that in more of the boss fights    -  Why did Varla need to die ;_;    -  Clements a Mother-lover

This isn't just some oh-so-ironic game about the juxtaposition of a typing game and a zombie shooter. This is the game that makes me wonder, 'why don't we have more typing-style games?' It should be a whole genre. Seriously, the typing part of the game is challenging and fun. Plus, for the price of one game, you actually get two, because it comes loaded with House of the Dead Overkill as well (it's the mouse-based version of Typing of the Dead). If you missed this game the first time around, now's the time to check out the foulest, most violent, and most gruesome shooter game of them all. Grindhouse fans, this is for you.

There isn't much fun and unique typing games in the market. Personally, I have never play a typing game before, and this title has used a rail shooter and turned it into a typing game. Sure, this is not the 1st of its kind but the overall presentation of the game is fantastic.  It present itself as a over the top B movie game with cheap and chessy lines being very well-voice acted.  If you are up for a typing game, as well as some over the top action with zombies in it, I would whole heartedly recommend this game.
Typing of the Dead  meets  Grindhouse . What else do you need to know?

Type as fast to stay alive. This is a typing game that will really push you to your limits. It can be funny at times what this game throws at you on what to type. Its a great challenge for slow typers and fast typers. It should teach you real fast not to look down at your fingers when you type. I have a blank keyboard and totally love playing this game. It pushes my typing to the next level.
A good typing game. It also got rail shooting mode, so you got 2 games in one. My only gripe is the story, dialog, voice acting and abusive F words all over the game. and no cool monster like Wizard.
I obsessively played Mavis Beacon as a kid so this is a great step up. ;3
Really awesome adaptation of house on-rail games but with a keyboard, it has a great B movie story and lots of content!
Great way to speed up typing/getting used to a new keyboard!
Fun moments like on arcade machines SEGA

I enjoyed this game a lot. Takes about 2 hours just to beat the game, but with those 2 hours you will get pure enjoyment. The cool thing i found out about this game is it includes the original house of the dead overkill which is a railshooter. If your trying to remember keys on your keyboard this game will help you remember a lot on where each key on your keyboard is at.  Pros Amazing compelling story voice acting well done blood splatter cheesy acting  Educational use with your keyboard Immersive Gameplay  Cons bugs in which when shooting an object it doesnt pick up sometimes  Note: In my opinion this is a great education game for kids, due to now a days kids find it hard to type while not looking. With this game kids can finally actually learn stuff and have fun instead of learning something and being bored. This is a great game but if your trying to get your 7-10 year old kid to learn this type of stuff i would recommend it, only downfall would be tons vulgar language in game so if bad language isnt on your book for your kid to learn stuff i would recommend downloading or getting the orignal typing of the dead
Destroyin dem badies with my 160wpm. 10/10
A new Typing of the Dead? This is everything I could have ever hoped for.

The original Typing of the Dead is one of my favorite games of all time. Somehow, this one misses the mark in two important ways.  1. The cutscenes in the original TOTD weren't supposed to be funny. Overkill clearly is, but the contrast between the allegedly serious (if badly executed) House of the Dead 2 and killing them with keyboards is funnier than when the game is already trying to be funny.  2. Far more crucially, in the original TOTD, the words were completely random. In Overkill, the words seem to be joing about the circumstances. Early playthroughs of the first level would give lots of words about horror movies. The boss characters even less random. I failed against a mutated cheerleader boss. Starting the battle again, I was getting the same words, all cracks at the mutant cheerleader's weight. I personally think the massive library of phrases the original would dispense randomly was far funnier and less boring to play.  These probably sound like nitpicks, but they sapped my enjoyment of the game. I'm sure I'll go back to it someday and play it to completion, because I love typing games. But I can't really recommend it.

Combining all the fun of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ horror B-movies with frantic keyboard clacking, TotD:O is a worthy addition to the House of the Dead franchise. While a novice typist might scoff at the lower difficulties, the tougher ones would absolutely demolish a hunt-and-peck secretary so bear this in mind when firing it up. Worth picking up if it's on sale~
Is it a typing tutor? Is it a terrible wanna-be grindhouse film? If you can forgive the fact there are no dreamcast/keyboard getups then this is pretty close to the perfect game.

get it on sale! i got it for $6 with all the DLC included!!!!!!!!!!!! includes small minigames, regular typing of the dead, and also typing of the dead without the typing but with mouse aiming. the game runs smooth and the graphics are ok, the effects are good. the only bad thing is it doesnt have 1366x768 resolution and some other popular ones, i dont think you can edit it in any files :(   for $6 it was worth it.

I didn't know this game can be so addictive. Honestly, when I started to play this game was just to kill time. Who knows it turns out that I spent nearly 4 hours once I started the game. Very good concept and the story is not bad. You won't regret to buy this game.

Good but not great  Its a fun niche game with a ridiculous (in a good way) story. Typing out 'okey dokey doctor jones' while fending of a horde of zombies is a great feeling. However I must compare this to the previous Typing of the dead game.  Much of the uniqueness of the first game are not present here.   The boss fights are poorly suited for typing in this game.   Gone are the sentence drills or answer a question fights of the first game. The boss fights are not much different from the regular zombies of just typing the word(s) before they attack. Another problem I feel with the game is that   it is too easy . Disclaimer: only ran through once on normal mode. Throughout the game the difficulty between levels was not noticable. On the last level I was still getting words that were 5 characters long. Maybe there were some marginally longer sentences to type out but i would not say it was significant increase in difficulty. Compared to the first game, the difficulty was very noticable with some zombies having very long words to type out. Also in the first game, when you die the difficulty changes dynamically.  The difficulty in this game is not dynamic compared to the first. The game also has some general buggy-ness . I had to restart once because when I finished typing out a zombies string, it disappered yet the zombie was still there rendering it impossible to me to beat him. Also the audio cut out many times when I had to face rage zombies. Probably the biggest knock I have for the game is that I came across   repeated phrases in a single level   (occured multiple times). I have never seen this happen in the previous game but there should be no reason I see the phrase Killing Twins twice in one level.   This too happened with the DLC I bought  . I believe the dlc is much much smaller than i expected it to be.  As many problems the game has, it just dumb and fun. Not many other games you can type and kill zombies. Buy it when it goes on sale. Or torrent the superior previous one. I highly recommend the latter.
didn't realise typing zombies to death could be such FUN!! awesome game
fun typing game, really pushes your wpm. makes you type combinations of words you never would otherwise. highly recommended, especially if you're a fan of house of the dead.

Absolutely great game. It's got a great sense of humor, and awesome gameplay. It also has the original The House of The Dead: Overkill on it, which is cool if you suck at typing. But let's hope you don't!
Arthritis simulator.
The best. Takes me back to Dreamcast days. The only thing missing are the overlays with the Dreamcast backpacks. In this case, I guess it would be a PC?
It make I type at words more better.
I really like typing games and if you do too this is pretty hilarious. I got it on the steam summer sale and I'd suggest to anyone that even remotely likes this kind of thing

Good game overall. If you're a fan of the original typing of the dead then I would say definitely get this one. It has much better graphics, a funnier story (not sure if the original House of the Dead games were intentionally funny or not), also has House of the Dead Overkill (played with controllers and mouse although I didn't try it).  While it may lack the modes, such as tutorials and specific letter challenges that the original Typing of the Dead had, it more than makes up for it with multiple difficulty settings, unlockables, a few challenges and a hardcore mode. Some people may find it offensive, but keep in mind this is done in the style of 70s Grindhouse movies, so sleaze, exploitation, gore and... typing.

What ever happened to games like this, people still need to learn how to type. Honestly this game does not really take the typing tutoring thing super serious but it does help you. I definitely notice by ability to type getting better. But it really is just for fun and nostalgia, which it supplies in abundance. If you miss this games from your child hood its an easy buy for 5 bucks.
Killed a zombie by typing herpes.  10/10

Much like the original, acts as the funnest way to keep your touch-typing on point. Epic grindhouse flavors, a difficulty setting that ranges from '♥♥♥♥♥' to '♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥' and a deliberately, hilariously dreadful narrative that's guaranteed to put a smile on your face.

I am a terrible typist! My CPM is revolting! I mistype frequently which is shameful! I'm having a ♥♥♥♥ing BLAST, I tell ya!  I do actually feel like I'm improving a bit with this game. Learning to type is not why you play Typing of the Dead though. You play it because the concept is just so stupid. You play it because a rail shooter where you type at enemies can be unaccountably fun and also ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥: Seriously tense sometimes! No horror game has ever raised my heart rate to the degree a silly typing game did at points.  YOU HURT ZOMBIES WITH WORDS. YOU HURT THEIR FEELINGS RIGHT OUT OF THEIR FACES. FEELING LOOKS LIKE BLOOD AND BITS OF FACE  As a bonus you get the original shooty version of the game! It's okay, but obviously not the main event here.  Sometimes the story and presentation does get a bit too close for comfort to the grindhouse movies it parodies. This means the game is really not PC and that can understandably bother some, so be warned.  Some graphics bugs can also happen, which is to do with AMD Radeon drivers I think.  Get this for a laugh when it's on sale, why the hell not?
Killed a zed by typing 'Holy f**king c**ks' 10/10, also pretty good practice for touch typing.

While it does not have the same kind of variety as the original, it still provides quite a challenge for typing efficionados. The world, story, and acting is a love letter to the grindhouse era of movies. It's a very challenging game with a hilarious story to tell. Also, you get House of the Dead: Overkill with it as well, which is the normal play mode in which you simply use your cursor to shoot enemies.
TAHNKS TO TISS GAME I TYPE SOOOOO GUD NOW
It's stupid, crass, has terrible writing, and is immensely enjoyable. Wouldn't pay more than $10 for it, though

By itself I recommend the game. I do however note that this game is a pale comparison to the Typing of the Dead on the Dreamcast. The gameplay is the same, but the original had a more involved analysis of your typing that would actually show your your weak spots. The boss fights in the original had more signature charm since the typing required to kill them were stories or essays typed out a sentence at a time, rather than just the same terse phrases used to kill common zombies.  This game fills a unique niche that can't be found anywhere else on Steam, but if you somehow have the chance to play the Dreamcast version, take that one.
Absolutely fantastic fun. I'd never played House Of The Dead so this content was all new to me. It's B-grade horror grindhouse and it never takes itself seriously. Awesome.
A new version of the classic Typing of the Dead. This time, it's Overkill. The mix of over the top 70s explotation with classic typing zombie killing is great!
It's the cult classic that was once exclusive to the Wii, mixed with the bonus content from the PS3, then made love to Typing Tutors.
This game is a great rail typer/shooter Just don't use the Z word

Okay...here's the thing: If you think of this game as a video game being played solely for entertainment value...this game is 'okay'. If you think of this as a typing program...it's the best that has ever existed. As silly and self-aware as the story mode is, it does actually teach you to be a better and faster typer. I became a phenomenal typer on the original Typing of the Dead. This version is even better because it's modern so you don't have to put up with old crappy graphics. You can play through the game with the mouse as an straight forward FPS, but it's not why this is worth buying. Seriously. Play it for an hour once a week. Your typing will improve. Guaranteed.

The game itself is fun, but you could get the same things in any other TotD titles. But when you reach the cutscenes, oh man do you want to rip your teeth out. It's just pushed to be ironically like a B-class movie to the point that it's not funny anymore, it's just cringy. And the bosses and the main bad guy are so forced to be disgusting that you vomit just for their desperate trying, not because they are actually disgusting. Also, I got through it in 3 hours, so it hasn't got any length whatsoever.
Typing skills finally paying off!!!
With the power of my blue cherry mx keys , i will click clack to slay all zombies

I liked pretty much everything about this game... except the voice acting. I understand it can't be perfect but it made me cringe pretty often lol.  Other then that, a pretty interesting story line and potty humor is the way to my heart. Oh, and the DLC dictionaries were are really good. DINKLEBERG!

I would give this game a good review even if it was just a straight port of the Wii version I own already.   With it being more content as well as being a new entry into the hilarious typing of the dead sub series of the already awesome house of the dead series well...can I give it a better rating? Like 11 or so? This game is so stupid and crude and hilarious it deserves at least that.

The only reason I have this much time in the game is because I got stuck in a crash boot loop. Cant get the game to open at all. Click it says its launching then nothing. Apparently it has windows 10 compatibility issues.

Have you ever wanted to kill some zombies, or rather mutants with your keyboard? No no, not like that. Use your words! Seriously though, type the living hell out of those creatures for a load of fun. The story is rather short, but there is a multiplayer option alongside of a leaderboard to see just how great (or pitiful) you really are compared to the rest of the world. Luckily though, the story is humorous, cheesy, and rather compelling for some reason. While it can be quite crude and rather silly, it is probably worth the laugh. The mechanics are simple, however it can be challenging given that you can type only a wee bit faster than a turtle can walk. Everybody is bound to have some sort of fun with this title! Really though, name a person who doesn't want to write a novel in order to kill a zombie, err, mutant. The graphics have improved a bit from the Wii port of House of the Dead: Overkill, which by the way is included in this purchase. The mechanics for that, however, are odd considering that you do not have a motion controller and must point and click to shoot. It's definitely a decent buy for fans of the series, and is definitely worth buying, but if you'd rather have a gun in hand and shoot your CRT television set with lasers, I would recommend playing the original few games. If you like typing your problems away, well, play this or the original Typing of the Dead on the Sega Dreamcast! Good luck surviving to all of the slow typers in the world; happy hunting!
This game made me typing faster than I can do. Good game for speed your fingers up! :D
Jackie Chan and Chris Rock look different
Unforgettable things in this game : Words you learn Experience typing fast Aethetic feeling   AN AFRICAN AMERICAN CURSING AT YOU AND THE 'MUTANTS'
To release the stress... pretty fun, but after a while it trurns boring.
Unforgettable things in this game : Words you learn Experience typing fast Aethetic feeling   AN AFRICAN AMERICAN CURSING AT YOU AND THE 'MUTANTS'
To release the stress... pretty fun, but after a while it trurns boring.

I see why this game (or, well, House of the Dead: Overkill) temporarily had the Guinness World Record for most profane video game. That and the grindhouse aesthetic weren't really my thing, but as someone who loved the original Typing of the Dead, this was pretty close and a lot of fun.  I'd have preferred the original, especially with the amazing little changes like keyboards instead of guns it had, and because House of the Dead 2 is one of my all-time favorite games, but I'm just glad a goofy niche title like Typing of the Dead actually got a sequel at all.  More seriously, though, it's a typing game and you have to be interested in that. If you're not, there's still House of the Dead mode, but I haven't actually tried that to see how it works on PC.

This game is a direct port it seems of the wii-u version House of the Dead overkill, now with typing. Using the controller in regular shooting mode is a lost cause, the sensitivity is crazy and the changing angles dont help at all. Using a mouse is well boring, that part is better played on wiiu. The typing is only ok, when there is dialog but your typing you cant hear the audio queue if your typing correctly which is annoying. its ok but the WiiU version is way way better just get that.  Rating: 5/10 Value: 4.99

The game have potential, but in this state, definitely not recommended.  - Bad animations, even chat goes behind mouth movement many times. Plus is not polish at all; best example is when they slap the glasses out of the cripple and, by magic, he still have them. - Humor is quite cheap. Is not even a B-rated movie, is a badly done bad movie. Something that you can find in /iam14andthisisfunny. Given that you don't see this type of movies because of the argument. But even this is a total cringe. - There is no really a gameplay. Just type as fast as possible with no really a strategy behind it.  - In general, the behavior of the zombies and the players is just silly. Since this is a rail shooter, is not really anything that you can do about it, even at your side. - Models, textures, everything looks like only one person is behind it, and is really bad at it.  Summarizing, unless you are a 10 year old who is discovering violence, girls, and videogames for the first time in your life, avoid this game. It is a waste of time.
If you're good at typing and love dark humour, you should get this, really comical.

Unexpectedly, the game DOES make you a better typer - especially when it comes to the symbols above the numbers (on a standard laptop keyboard).  The story is intentionally campy but quite funny, and the type-to-kill gameplay is solid. The only part I didn't enjoy so much was the last boss fight, as it had you guessing for terms in what should have been a fast-paced fight.  Also, getting this game also gives you access to the original shooter this was based on: House of The Dead: Overkill. Really good value.
The game won't launch and forces the need to restart the computer upon launch.

2 missions in :   First mission - awesome, very funny, very good way to learn, nice generic theme.  Second mission - erm...so...how do i explain, you play as a stripper, fighting zombie strippers and patrons, I am not even sure I came out of that still sane.  10/10 would type smexts to a zombie again.

I have been looking forward to this game for ages and was excited to see it on sale to justify my purchase. However, I have sitll been unable to play. Why? Black screen and I can't even end the task when Ctrl+Alt+Delete. Apparently this is a common problem. I'm still wading through the Steam forums to try more fixes.  So far, these have NOT worked to get a launch: Updated graphics driver. Adjusted the default NVIDIA graphics processer Deleted AppData config file. Updated DirectX  If you want to struggle to start this bugger, go ahead and purchase if you're interested. However, right now I'm saying it's not worth the headache. It is absolutely not worth full price, even if I finally get this thing to work.

The next installment of the Mavis Beacon saga takes a dark turn. Overall a high quality sequel but I am still confused as to why they dropped the intersting plot elements concerning the strife between the Reptile Cartel and Insect Syndicate brought up in the 'Chameleon Picnic' level. Sadly I think this is on the publisher's part in an attempt to avoid controversy.
One hell of a motherf#@king ride.
Was kinda expecting the House of the Dead, just a typing version of the arcade version, this is a little cheesy and boob infested but I'll take it
It's ♥♥♥♥ing good!   ... for a Sega game....

The appeal gets old quick. At first I found the idea novel and was interested. Quickly, however, the game became tired.  Lets start off with the main mechanic. Typing words or phrases to kill/shoot zombies instead of aiming a gun. I love this idea. I dont so much love the implementation though. To many times you will start typing a word for who you think will attack next only to be completly wrong and have a different zombie attack. There should be some kind of numerical or color code as to what will attack you next so you can apply a priority. I also felt a words were often nonsensical. I feel more could have been done to apply clever puns or more interesting phrases to contribute more to the theme.  The graphics are pretty horrible. Its like they didn't try to hard or thought that the cheesy b movie theme could carry it. The movie grain effects often get in the way and cause some eye strain when played for to long.  The story is pretty bad even by B movie standards. Its is uninteresting, non funny, and depends on scraping the bottom of the barrel.  The boss fights are more interesting than most of the game but still leave a lot to be desiered. The later bosses feel more luck based than anything else.  All in all I dont think I can recommend this game. Its a novel idea but is exectued badly. Wait for a sale if it interests you.
Oh this game takes me back. Out of nostalgia I'd give it a 10/10. Classic trash shooting range.

If you took the genre of movies like Planet Terror, Death Proof and Machete known as grindhouse and made a game you would end up with something like this. It is very over the top, campy, filled with clever word play. I don't know what I was expecting from a typing game but they certainly out did them selves.
This is the best ************* typing game I've ever ******* seen! This is the ****! If you don't enjoy this game so much you **** all over yourself, then you're just ****** up!

This game have two modes: one is typing of the dead, another is the house of the dead. Typing of the dead is mostly done by typing. While you are typing, the charaters are shooting dudes with guns. With the new Shakespeare expansion you could type some like 'for my own part, it was Greek to me'. You have to do some serious typing to get pass some of the boss fight.  The house of the dead has the exact same setting, but instead of typing, you left click to shoot dudes. Frankly, the house of the dead is kind of boring.  Nonetheless, the typing of the dead is really fun and surpisingly educational at the same time. In order for the game to be educational, don't pick up the Filth DLC. The Filth DLC contains all the bad words.  There are serveral drawbacks. Just like other Capcom games, the ladies are addressed outageous with redonkulous body. The dialogues are corny with terrible voice acting. The voice acting is just terrible, it is not even funny. Besides these, I would definitely recommand this game to mature audience.

They no longer use keyboards with dreamcasts (I guess this would be pcs or something) strapped to their back. But House of the Dead: Overkill has one of the stupidest plots out their and it's great to experience it again.

Waaay back in the early 90s, there was 'The Typing Of The Dead. A game I played at work. Yes, the company invested in a typing game to see if it improved our touch typing skills. Of course, it didn't, but memories of blokes walking around with Dreamcasts strapped to their backs made me want this. Firstly 0 points for the system specs listed They seem to be much higher than what's needed... 'Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 6450, NVIDIA GeForce GT 220 or Intel Integrated Graphics HD 3000 '. I'm running this on an ATI Radeon 4650 with drivers from 2012. Works like a charm  My one bug-bear with the game, and I can't believe I'm typing this, is the amount of unneccesary swearing in the game. I'm not syaing it in a prudish way, but it's used so often, it just comes across as lazy and forced. I spend every cut scene not actually paying attention to the story, but thinking 'I wonder when the next unneccessary F-bomb comes al.... ah, there it is.' Storyline-wise, it's not a game that grips you. Unless you're a 'house Of The Dead' fan, I assume.  And so, to the gameplay. This is where it's the killer. You can either touch-type or you can't. If you can, graphics are important, and I can't possibly make a valid comment on them, as a) my card is a generation or so below the minimum and b) I can't touch type, meaning that my eyes are constantly flitting away from the screen around the keyboard.  I'll probably keep returning to it, putting in an hour or so here or there. I can't help feeling that it could have been so much more

I love the DLC Libraries for this game. 10/10 would type sticky fingered flap worrier again.

Not only is The House of the Dead: Overkill possibly the finest example of the series thus far with its great gameplay(with a variety of weapons), great story, nice atmosphere(graphics and music wise) and excellent humor, but the Typing of the Dead Overkill is also the best example in the spinoff series (there was actually a TOD II but it was only released in Japan). This is mainly because the already humorous game now has humorous words to type in order to kill zombies. Not only is it funnier, but the gameplay is really smooth and it has made me a much better typist! The game is perfect for zombie game fans and Keyboarding class students(Seriously? you need to take a high school class just to learn how to type!?) alike. The game is even better in the multiplayer. That way you get to have funny discussions about the absolutely absurd things you have to type!  At its regular price the game is already at a bargain. At the sale, it's an absolute steal and if you have $10 to spare, don't hesitate to get this!  Just one tip for playing regular HOD: Overkill: It's very awkward and hard to play it with a laptop trackpad or a controller. Get yourself a proper computer mouse to play it.

Great tool if you want to improve typing. Also fun to play through

Super fun and kind of odd

RIDICULOUS game and I mean that in the best way possible! The gameplay is what I expected - typing, typing and more typing (it is worth mentioning that the things you have to type in are amusing). However, I was pleasantly suprised by how fun this damn game is! The dialogue and characters are over-the-top and entertaining and made me want to play through the game quickly. The only bad thing I really have to say is that it feels short....or maybe that's just because I want more of it. Haven't tried the multi-player version of it but I am curious about it. Unless f-bombs make you want to hold your mother at night, buy this game, especially if it's on sale! Not sure if it's $20 good but I am a cheapskate. Word.

Only 5 seconds into the intro for the first mission, and already the protagonist is throwing around the F-Bomb.  Awesome.   But honestly, this game is great. It's just spewing cheesy clichés and stays entertaining.  Just keep your mother ♥♥♥♥ing kids out of the mother ♥♥♥♥ing room.
At first you think wtf, then you play it and it's just pure awesome typing gory fun.

Play through story mode with either typing or shooting. Either is fun imo. It's worth pointing out that the entire game is on-rails so if you're not into that kinda thing, this is not for you.  The story mode should take you a few hours to complete. Nice enemy and level variation as well as some fun bosses. The writing and acting is horrible, but the devs are very aware of it and wears it like a badge. The 70's cinematography and character stereotypes make for some pretty funny moments. The Typing of The Dead: Overkill is not a game to be taken seriously, but it doesn't make it any less enjoyable.

Killed a zombie by typing 'Lube'  10/10  Serious: This game is a great way of combining the intentionally awful B-movie campaign of The House of the Dead: Overkill with all the fun of touch typing software. The dialogue is pretty much carried over from the original game, as are the cutscenes, with the only difference being the typing mechanic replacing the rail shooter. It's also worth noting that  The House of the Dead: Overkill  is also included so you can play both the typing and shooting versions.

Oh my dear lord this game is awful. I enjoyed playing the first game back in the day. But this one just doesn't even try. Graphics are awful, half the time the zombies full body doesnt even display. Save you're money.   Could be good if you are trying to enhance typing speed....but still not very bearable.

*Effective, engaging typing mechanic with a varied and often humorous word-bank. *Delightfully cheesy music, story, and design (think exploitation pastiche meets Sega arcade excess.) *Unlockable weapons, assets, game modes and a levelling system to keep things interesting.  I'm a fan of the original HoTD, but picked this up strictly for the typing. I was pleasantly surprised by just about every aspect of the game. Updates to HoTD include a bolted-on (and somewhat irrelevant) unlock/levelling system, a new story and characters, and a multicolored galaxy of funny and grotesque new assets. I would have liked fewer, more significant, unlockables and more variety in the typing mechanics of the boss fights, but the deliberately silly story and dialogue worked for me. Likewise, the gross-out visuals and overall aesthetic, which is remarkably consistent and well-executed throughout. Shooting on rails may feel flat to some, but here the level design seldom misses a trick and the colorful remake injects a lot of verve. Add to that the surprisingly effective typing mechanic (my touch-typing skills have definitely improved) and you have a unique gem of a game.

This game is a vast improvment over the origonal 1999 typing of the dead. also comes with a ps3 port of Overkill played with mouse or controller. offers much variety to gameplay and replayability. Along with funny dialoge and a old Tarantino feel, plus the additional dictionaries. very enjoyable game. 10/10
Hand Cramp Simulator 2013  10/10 would cramp again

I absolutely love this game. The music and storyline are great. Finally, a reason to use my keyboarding skills I learned in high school electives. At the time of writing this review I have played 3 hours and have had a blast every moment. I definitely recommend this game to anyone who can type without looking.
This game is hilarious. Seriously, I almost died laughing. Loved the typing, it made an overused genre (rail shooter) really fun and interesting. Try it out!
It's a rail shooter where you kill zombies not by shooting at them but typing at them!  Finally, my 80 WPM skills can be put to use!
Has coarse language off the get go, not ideal for kids you dont want hearing bad words, if u dont care fire it up and enjoy :) does have merit for typing skills

One is the traditional type to kill the other is simply shooting since you automatically move.I actually have a high anticipation for this one now I'm so disappointed. Hilarious and dripping in tongue-in-cheek macabre that is reminiscent of the grindhouse genre of film made popular most recently by Quentin Tarantino; think even raunchier Planet Terror (and here you were thinking that wasn’t possible). More laid back than the typical zom - I mean mutant - game because … well because you’re typing ridiculous words and phrases like “Nibbler” and “Eccentric anesthesiologist” while flesh eating monsters jump out at you.
hilarious, makes you realise you can't spell. Cut scenes are also wonderfully messed up

You need this game, don't talk, just buy it. The 'filth of the dead' DLC is life affirmingly good. I loved the original typing of the dead and this is an order of magnitude better. Tons and tons of replay value, it makes learning or brushing up on yoru typing fun.

I only played this game because it is spin-off of the ThotD series that I loved as a kid. Unfortunately it is ♥♥♥♥. Bosses are just boring, music is simple. One good thing is that you can play regular railway shooting style, not just typing.

While Overkill may be my least favourite HotD game, I have nothing but positive things to say about the revival of Typing of the Dead.  It's amongst the best typing games out there, definitely worth picking up!

The story of The Typing of the Dead: Overkill doesn't really matter, because it's a ♥♥♥♥ story - a black dude and a white dude going into some haunted house to kill zombies. But the interaction between the two dudes is sick. It's like a rip off of a cheezy B movie, and it's beautiful.
Not cheesy at all.

WARNING: This game contains mature content. Extremely mature content.  On the other hand, I'm yet to play a better typing help game. Unfortunately the voice acting isn't as awesomely bad as the original Dreamcast version and I do wish there were more penalties for missing letters (on normal), but it's intense, it's fun, you can laugh at it, and it does what it's designed to do.
Super awesome pulp with gruesome zombie stuff and typing.

This game is best experienced with a clickity clackity mechanical keyboard (others are good too) and a decent typing speed  This game is refreshing from what you'd get from a railshooter and a typing game. Although there are many other games that require a lot of typing, this has a lot of variety. The enemies are different, and this would be from typing a letter within milliseconds, or a single a word within a second. They have zom... MUTANTS that will rush at you and explode vomit, small animals like mutant birds or monkeys (they vary which mission you play, but they kinda have the same properties), and a couple more. You just don't type a sentence within a time period, you have to choose which mutant you want to type first, as they will throw things at you, while the others attack you. If you type 57-60 WPM without errors, you will be fine, but there are opportunities for extra damage in boss battles for those who type a couple million words per second. The level design (well doesn't matter since it's a railshooter), is pretty as each level takes you into a completely different place, as the setting fits each level fine (The train level is really cool.) It even contains the full 'House of the Dead: Director's Cut' from the PS3 version, so you can mouse click all you want. The graphics are meh, as animation is sloppy (although the executions are satisfying), the lip-syncing is not good, some textures are blurry, and Washington's bald head doesn't have enough polygons. It's good enough, as the lighting (in my opinion) is very nice. It's optimized, as I get over 60FPS in 1080p (with a GTX550Ti), so you should be able to run it on a crappy computer. The cutscenes has a lot of film grain/texture, a narrator with a cool voice, and the story resembles a movie-like plot. The game is hilarious, ♥♥♥♥ING FILLED WITH PROFANITY (NO JOKE), and the main two characters are likeable (but some are just really flat and don't have much to them). The dialogue is really odd sometimes (not the cursing), but it might be just me. It's has a lot of laughs, has some horror here and there (great maps), and overall a great buy for 20 dollars (although I got it for 6 on the humble bundle, which was a steal.)   GET THIS GAME, IT'S SO FUN AND YOU WILL FEEL LIKE A TYPING GOD.
7/7 Would type again
Sassy cops and mutants...what more could I want!? (also comes with normal shoot em up version of the game so not just typing =D )

An intellectually stimulating combination of symbolic game design, brilliant visuals, an immersive soundtrack, and a post-modern story that will leave you pondering its implications for months. I consider this the best videogame ever made.

I have started using this to judge how good a particular keyboard is, have settled on the Black Widow as my favourite. Finally, foul language and grindhouse gore can be educational!
Exactly what you'd expect. I don't understand why the rendering resolution is locked at 720p or whatever.

After playing the original Typing of the Dead (really really old SEGA game based on a really old House of the Dead), I was thrilled to have it back again, but this time, with the bugs ironed out! Great typing game with the fun and story of House of the Dead. Would easily recommend this game to almost anyone who can use a keyboard (although the storyline could be a little over the top/PG for some).   One tiny thing is the co-op play is ever so slightly difficult to use (not sure if it's network problems, some mysterious and badly-timed cut-outs) and they should probably think about having voice chat enabled in-game, because alternating between Steam's chat boxes and trying to kill zombies in-game (all with the same keyboard) is a little bit difficult!  Overall, fantastic game.

Good game, not worth £14.99, though. Its too short and too undetails for that. The game itself is great, with good, witty lines and unique gameplay. However, the story is very short (I did the whole game on agent difficulty (medium) in 3 and a half hours on my first go)), the final boss is poorly done, and the ending is not an ending at all, I'd recommend it heartily, but only if its 66% of more off.
Been a while since I last had so much fun! It's rather easy, even in mofo mode, but I hope hardcore mode will provide the challenge I'm looking for. ++

Decent concept for a typing trainer, but unless you're a repressed teenager... this just comes across as purile to the Nth degree.  Turn off the voice and music and just leave the sound effects. Skip the cutscenes with endless polygonal boob shots and swearing. It's meant to be shlocky, but it's a poor imitation of the Tarantino Grindhouse thing, and not of the actual shlock cinema of the 70's. A parody to an homage?  The rail aspect of it can get annoying too... sometimes there is just too much waiting for the camera to move, and for the idiotic dialogue to be spoken that interrupts your actual purpose of interacting/typing.  The traditional rail shooting mode is... everything that was ever wrong with a rail shooter put onto a PC and expected to use a mouse instead of a light gun. It's boring... BORING!!!  All in all though, as an actual typing trainer, it's decent enough. It could have been a lot better, but as it stands for the actual mechanics, it's decent enough to keep typing interesting... IF you don't waste your time with the useless cutscenes!

This game is stupid.  Let me rephrase that: this game has a terrible story, terrible voice acting, terrible aesthetic, and makes me feel like banging my head on my desk to black the image of it from my mind.  That said, maybe they meant it to be that way. Even if they didn't, they should pretend they did. Because for all its failures, this is actually the only entertaining typing game (don't bother with the non-typing version unless you're a masochist) I've played outside of Mavis Beacon from about 15 years ago (though, admittedly, I haven't played a ton of typing games).  So, I'm actually RECOMMENDING this game if you want to play it as a typing game. I also recommend playing it with the sound OFF.
A must have for horror-loving keyboard warriors!
SQUEE!!  I mean, it's a fun game. Well worth 5 to 10 bucks when it's on sale.  Great arcade style action with hilariously over the top cut scenes. NOT for people who are unfamiliar with touch-typing.

A fun little romp. It's literally a PC port of House of the Dead: Overkill with what you could call a slight mod that replaces guns with the keyboard. Unfortunately there are no other changes to the game which means the gameplay doesn't suit the Typing of the Dead style. The enemies lack almost all variety and the bosses (with one or two exceptions) are a let down. I really won't recommend any this game to anyone outside of those who really love Typing of the Dead or House of the Dead: Overkill.

This game looks very similar to the movie Planet terror, and the cinematics are narrated like a trailer for 80's horror movies.  Graphically, the game is not really impressive, but its allright.  The music is great.  The dialogs are extremely obsene and funny.  Overall the game is funny, nice cutscenes, nice gameplay, decent gore, silly narrative and on top of that, you polish your typing skills. What are you waiting for?

Pros: Fun game, and works really well in Parallels on a Late 2012 Retina Macbook.  Cons: It'd be nice if they had a censored mode so that I could use it to teach my kid to type. Sure, you could mute it, but having to set the difficulty level to a word for a female dog doesn't exactly get around it. I also miss the heroes running around with keyboard mounts like they did in the original ToTD.

Typing of the Dead: Overkill is a typing/rail shooter game, where you type phrases as quickly as possible to kill zombies. I've always kind of enjoyed typing games, and while I don't think this game has much merit in teaching you how to type properly, it's a fun game with an interesting sense of humor.  There's not too much to talk about with the gameplay. You type as quickly as possible, using Tab to pick up secrets and power-ups. What's more interesting to discuss with this game is how it's presented: as an old, low-budget horror movie. It tries very hard to be as cheesy as possible. Sometimes the phrases you type relate to the level you're playing, which gets pretty funny in the strip club level. This game is a bit lewd at times, and the swearing is excessive... not saying that's a bad thing, but it's something you should know going in to it.  Typing of the Dead: Overkill also includes House of the Dead: Overkill. The story is the same, but you play a standard rail shooter with normal controls instead of typing. I like switching between the two, just to change things up. House of the Dead is a little older, but as far as I know, this the only way to play the game on PC.  If a rail shooter or typing game sounds fun to you, then this would be a good game to pick up. There's a lot of content in this game, so at $20, I don't think you'll be disappointed. Rail shooters and typing games aren't for everyone, and this game probably won't win you over to the genre (unless the movie aesthetic really appeals to you, I guess), but I've had a lot of fun with it so far, and I plan to keep playing it for a little while.
A must have for every classroom
This is the most gruesome, ridiculous, hilarious, gory, stupid fun you will ever have while learning to type. This should be a staple for anyone with a computer.

It's not really the well-intentioned-but-superbly-♥♥♥♥-voice-acting game from before. More of a grindhouse film that's completely self-aware and a crap-ton of fun anyways. This isn't your dad's typing game, this is typing on cocaine with explosions , guns, and gore!

My god! Now I've played the old typing of the dead and I enjoyed the novelty and difficulty it brought to the table. This new iteration blows me away. It's focus on speed typing mixed with grind-house horror is probably the best thing I've ever seen happened to The dead series. The dialog between characters is most likely some of the most cheesy out of whack dialog I've ever heard; and I'm enjoying the hell out of it. This game is simply great fun.
This game is awesome! It's House of the Dead meets Mavis Beacon! I loved HotD, and I was a nerdy kid who enjoyed Mavis Beacon, so this is fantastic! I recommend this highly :D
It takes a certain type of sense of humor to enjoy this game, but it's a true gem. Not for the easily offended.

This game also has a normal shooting version in it, which instantly makes it worth the money. However, like most things on steam, might as well wait till it's on sale to buy it =P   The storyline, is the absolute worst thing ever, but, it's so bad, that it's good O_O
despite the saying that you should never bring a keyboard to a zombie fight, this game is pretty fun

' Suffer, like G did? ' --The House Of The Dead 2   OVERALL:  Sega and Modern Dream did a really good job with The Typing Of The Dead: Overkill! From a style standpoint the game is a convincing and loving homage to grindhouse flicks and video nasties that left me laughing. Looking at the technical end, the port runs smoothly even on a mobile i3 with integrated video, and the developers have paid particular attention to the control scheme.  The Typing Of The Dead: Overkill is a prequel to the rest of Sega's lightgun horror(?) series, and it's a very well-made one at that! The series' hallmark corny writing and amazing soundtracks are there as usual, but everything is much more deliberately integrated: In something of a contrast to the rest of the series' style, the homages to classic grindhouse films and B-movies are more obvious and lavish amounts of effort have been put into making the game really seem like something one might see featured along with other modern homages to the genre like Planet Terror or Machete. As a bit of a movie fan, this is a detail I really liked!  Moving on, I mentioned some ingenuity with the control scheme. Though Overkill did not get an arcade release like the rest of the series, the core gameplay is still very much in the vein of Overkill's lightgun-based precursors. This integrated logically enough with the Wii's wiimote and the PS3's sensors, but how does one adapt a game like this for a platform with no good analogue for lightgun controls? Sega opted to simply cut the gordian knot here and change the game to a typing-themed edutainment game! Don't be fooled, though; This is far more entertaining of a typing game than  Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing  or  JumpStart Racer . You'll find yourself blowing away scads of undead abominations by typing out a variety of amusingly absurd phrases. This is a time-tested approach on Sega's part: PC versions of previous House Of The Dead games were handled in a similar manner, though it seems like the boss fights were implemented in a more varied way with past releases.  For those who would rather not fight their way to victory through stenanography, a mouse-and-keyboard based mode that foregoes the typing in favor of more lightgun-ish gameplay is still there. as of my writing this review, though, I have not been able to take that mode for a spin yet.
You'll type till you're hard, then type till you wipe. 10/10 would Type more -IGN

Holy ♥♥♥♥ I love this game.  Ok ok, remember when you were a kid and you went to the arcade and decided to pick up one of those guns and play one of those game? Well, this game works almost exactly the same except instead of actually aiming and shooting like a peasant, you succumb to the master race and use a keyboard to masterfully press keys in succession to murder zombies.   Sure, that doesn't sound particularly entertaining. I mean, who really wants to type an essay when playing a game, right? Not to worry, the game has hilarious over-acting and voice overs. The pacing of the game is varied enough to keep you on your toes all the time. You don't really know when 30 zombies are suddenly going to be around that corner.   The pressure to not make any mistakes is big in this game, as exemplified by the combo meter. For each word/phrase that you don't butcher, you get either a silver or gold bullet in your top right barrel-thing (that's the technical term). The more of those bullets you get in succession, the higher your combo reward is. This prevents people from just rolling their heads on their keyboards until enough letters are thrown out to form the word on accident. I mean, sure, you can still do that, but don't. If you do, you're a moron... Unless you do it systematically with your nose or something. If you can do that, props to you.  Anyway, the only major gripes I had with this game were: I found myself mashing TAB all the time because I wanted to pick up all the things. I'm a completionist and bottles are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s because I don't have large backspace key (Who makes mistaeks?) so that made that difficult to cancel out of a word to hit the bottle before I took damage. But aside from that, the game is excellent. It will also encourage people to learn to type without looking at the keyboard, which is an essential skill for anybody ever, especially anyone reading this because they're using a computer. So go out and buy this game. It's on sale as of the time of posting this... I think. EVEN IF IT WASN'T, YOU SHOULD STILL TOTALLY PICK IT UP, IT'S GREAT ENTERTAINMENT.

Played this a long time ago on the Wii and almost bought the PS3 version with the extra 2 stages (but didn't) and this seems like the best of both versions. Its got all the extra content from the PS3, and it also has 2 ways to play it, 1 with typing on a keyboard or 2 playing the original version of the game with out the words and just a controller or mouse. I'm not sure if you can use a Wii remote or a PS3 Move controller but I wouldn't be surprised with some kind of 3rd party program you probably can. Either way this is a lot of fun.
I had to type 'nipple madness.' You're not going to get that from Mavis Beacon.

I highly recommend this to anyone who wants practice getting better at typing. Imagine using your keyboard to shoot zom...I mean mutants' heads off. The background behind this game is that it is a spinoff from the main House of the Dead franchise and possibly a prequel before the first game. Unlike the main games, though, this one comes packed with plenty of swearing (do not say I did not warn you).  The few complaints I have about this game is the multiplayer. I wish there was a local setting so I could plug in another keyboard. A few more include enemies glitching into scenes and enemies having no words, making them invincible. Last but not least, I have some issues with no words appearing right before a enemy/boss attacked. This gave me no chance in getting in a hit, and i would have to wait until I got hit.  Other than those downsides, I believe most of the glitches happen if you play on Hardcore mode. Just play the game normally and you will have a blast!
This game is an enjoyable game.
They should have this game in schools, so kids can learn how to type

A great successor to the classic Typing of the Dead from the sega Dreamcast. Super fun way to increase your typing speed and accuracy! If my typing class in middleschool had this game I wouldnt have been nearly as bored!

Typing of the Dead: OVERKILL is one of my dream games. The surprise release of this almost made me scream my pants. I loved the original 'OVERKILL' when it was on the Wii. After finishing that one, I wished SEGA would revisit it with the typing tutor treatment, like they did with their oddball 'Typing of the Dead.' For a game filled with profanity and lulz, it just cried for it. I very happy they did.  Providing your typing skills are up to par and you have a desktop to run it (This game HATES laptops) it's as fun as the original. For the port of the original OVERKILL, the mouse doesn't always substitue well for a light gun and the cutscenes animations aren't always stellar. (Mouths move up and down like hand-puppets; animation and dialouge isn't always synced.) The menus could've been redesigned for PC in mind, especially the 'Memorabilia' screens, which are tedious to browse through.   Don't get me wrong, this is still a fun game. For being a rail-shooter on the PC, it's ported decently. I'd much prefer a light gun, but I see OVERKILL as a proof of concept: that you can port an arcade-style shooter to the PC. In that regard, I'd love to see childhood favorites like Time Crisis 2 and CarnEVIL make the jump.  Ah, but we're here for the 'Typing' aspect of the game: why would they even bother if that wasn't the case? Well, if you've played the classic 'Typing of the Dead' you know what you're getting into; this time, though, no skimping on the gore and no in-mission challenges.   As a person who needs to look at the keyboard, and also having studied a freind with mad typing skills, I can assure you that the typing portions are well-executed, though may be unfair during the boss battles and any instance where you have to juggle zombie killing with shooting projectiles. Some of the boss battles can also be unfair; like the Screamer in Ballistic Trauma, who at one point hides behind zombies and is unable to attack until they are all dispatched. (In contrast, in the regular mode, you can just Handcannon her to death.)   Your milage may vary on the record-breaking F-Bombs, crude humor, and the comically offensive scenarios and characters, but you need to remember that they're going for the faux-sploitation style (See 'Planet Terror', 'Machete') and in that regard it's well-executed; wonderfully over-the-top. Exploitation/Trash film geeks should look out for nods to the classics. ('I don't try anything, I just do it!')   I like to end with a note to those who ported this to the PC: it should've been better optimized for the common laptop. This game is a few years older than some newer SEGA titles, which have run decently for me in the past. Failing to get this to work on my laptop almost pushed me to demand a refund. If OVERKILL can be ported for Android phones without much problem (albeit the trims), there's hardly an excuse for someone to have to use duct tape and user suggestions to get it to work.  All-and-all, despite the laptop issues and porting hiccups, highly recommended.

Obscenely vulgar, but in a mostly comedic way.  THIS IS NOT A TYPING TUTOR FOR CHILDERN.  Every other line said in the game contains the F bomb. Actually scratch that, every line in the game does.  And no joke, the game's climax is when the bad guy   crawls back into his mother's ♥♥♥♥♥♥.   Not joking.  Do not buy this for children.

All the cheesiness of a terrible 70's action movie with the gameplay of an arcade rail-shooter, and although the single player is fun, the multiplayer experiences you can have with your friends is what makes this game a great success.
Its ehh..you type and ♥♥♥♥ dies. Enjoyable from time to time.

One of the best House of the Dead games converted for use with keyboard, Typing of the Dead Overkill falls head over heels with the grindhouse genre. Bad acting, horrible script, and stupid one liners are accompanied by more blood, swearing, and sex jokes than there are zombies.
This is one of the best educational game EVER. Play it and learn how to type like a beast.
Whoa that brings me back
Isaac Washington is my hero <3 A++ Husbando Of The Year!!!!
Way more campy and over-the-top than the original, but as fun as ever!
Typed ridiculous things and killed mutants.  10/10 would type again.

Like the title says, this is a typing game with a zombie theme (and a retro movie aspect). Some of the scenes are kinda funny, while others can be really creepy and weird (like the final boss scene). So, expect something light and heavy with this game.   There was a lot of repeat words/phrases on each scene, so a larger variety would've been nice but not entirely a bad thing. There were added bonuses with each round, such as finding certain items which gave the game a bit of a boost from just being a typing game.   Overall, the game was enjoyable for what it was and if you like typing games, I'd give this one a try.

It's a typing game... filled with little cult easter eggs, and revolves around parodying the b-rated grindhouse horror zombie movie genre... It's so good in how bad it is at times, with tons of f-bombs!
THIS GAME IS FUN AS HELL! IF YOU ENJOY ZOMBIE GAMES AND/OR FUNNY GAMES GET THIS GAME.   ps if you find the typing aspect stupid then you also have the mode where you can use your mouse sao thats a +
Surprisingly addictive

i never knew a game like this existied and im happy that i got it, teaches you how to type without looking at your hands. just got it today so i am still super slow at typing but i will get better once i play it more and more. over all great game for beginners to learn how to type and it takes time

Does it work? Yes. Well, mostly. If you just want a typing game set in a zombie-shooting scenario, then this works. However, if you want a polished game that is worth the asking price, this is not it. It can be entertaining, but all of the bugs and visual glitches ruin most of the experience for me.

Great game. Funny, good music, surprisingly good and challenging game play with typing instead of shooting with a mouse or a controller. Just the right length of game too. not too long and not too short so if you have a huge pile of shame like me then you can tick one off. Normally I don't replay many games but I could easily see this being replayed (especially with different dictionaries loaded) if you want to sharpen your typing. I have to 'mother£$*&ing' reccommend this game! 8.5/10 :)

This game is probably one of the better typing games in existance at the moment it is very fun but the humor is so hit and miss good joke here bad joke there and not har har funny bad pun but just a bad joke and the swear words 2/3 words are not actual words but this game is very very fun
Ridiculously over the top action scenes and dialog. Pretty much exactly the same as the Wii game, but with typing! I really need to work on typing numbers.

I played this back on the Wii when I owned one.. the story is beautifully bad, the dialogue has a few words that aren't profane, and the gore (and level design) are top notch. Typing, instead of shooting, takes some getting used to, but it seems like a great trainer for those learning to type. If only I had had this back in 3rd grade.. I would be a beast with a keyboard (note: definately not recommended for younger crowds, despite that).  EDIT: Nice, it also comes with the original version of House of the Dead: Overkill, so you can shoot instead of type if you wish.
I can play this at work, and people just think I'm typing up a lot of documentation!

I was only expecting a Typing of the Dead game, but as it turns out, it also has the regular House of the Dead game! Romp the game in two ways, Type your way or Shoot everything using your mouse! Great game!
Amount of ♥♥♥♥ in this game : 189
It's worht playing, it's fun, and witha friend stuff can only get better!
Steven Hawking turned into a psychic zombie and has a hot sister. 10/10

Most fun I have had at my computer for months. Filled up with games over Christmas and almost all of them were very 'meh' but got this on the Sega sale and really enjoying it.   Does not take its self seriously and enjoyed every minute.
This game is buggy as hell, but it's mother♥♥♥♥ing great.

Words fail me. This is such a good game. Presented as a cross between pulp fiction and grindhouse terror the graphics are 10/10. It's also educational. I have a das keyboard ultimate, which means I don't have any lettering on my keyboard. It makes things pretty interesting, let me tell you :D  The game itself is great fun, you unlock comic pages, good sound tracks, game character sprites and poster art.   Graphics 10/10 Music 10/10 Plausibility 0/10 Humour 10/10 Dialog 8/10 Entertainment value 9/10 Replayability 10/10  10/10 would beat a zombie to death with a keyboard again.
Kill zom... I mean mutants by typing words accurately and fast. It also features some hilarious B movie dialogue. Took some tinkering to get it to run properly though.

I think this is the most fun you can have with typing on a keyboard. Dialogues and voice acting are hilarious. But the endless arcade modes is where the adrenaline is.  Excellent menu music. Listen to those lyrics.
pretty hard but awesome very planet terror and did i say awesome
Hilarious, challenging, and fun. Full of charm, humor, and cheese. Great!
Typing of the dead on steroids
Filled with swearing, gore, cheesy lines, and the original version of House of The Dead: Overkill with a variety of weapons and upgrades.  Worth every penny.

It's the perfect game. You need to use a controller, which is the biggest letdown. (That's a joke)  Anyway, the game is intentionally supposed to be a 'B' movie with a lame story, overacting, and over the top action and locations.  If you're easily offended by bad language or violence, then stay away. Everyone else, this is a great sequel to the Dreamcast (and later PC) game. The vulgarity and violence, extremely moronic characters bring the world of cheese to a new level.

There's typing, and there there's typing when a mutant is trying to eat your face. While rail-shooters aren't really my thing, Typing of the Dead is very much my kind of thing. If you happen to be trying to learn to type, or are just trying to keep your keyboarding fresh, play Typing of the Dead. How many chances do you have to blast mutants by typing at them?  I suggest this to everyone, especially if you're learning to type. This game has helped my typing speed and accuracy considerably when I was first learning and it still helps me get better. Good purchase.

I've been eyeing this game for quite a long time. Once it was on sale, it was a no brainer (pun intended). I love this game. Unfortunately, one technical issue with it has halted all reason for me to play it. I'm not sure if it's a Windows 10 issue, but the game doesn't quit properly, it simply leaves me with a black screen.  Just wait for the game to be on sale and try it for yourself, you'll most likely enjoy it.

This package contains: - An over-the-top grindhouse action story that would make Robert Rodriguez nod in approval. - A character that uses 'mother f***ker' instead of punctuation. - A hyper-sexualized character that probably walked in right off a set with Quentin Tarantino. - All the joys of the original Typing of the Dead (2000) in which you use .45cal nouns and verbs to lay waste to hordes of the living dead.  This game is a great way to turn the brain off and type zombies to death (again). It's an ideal time sink when you're on a long flight and can't use a mouse. Take this one to the coffee shop and the furious typing will make it seem to passers by that you're working hard on that novel of yours.  Bottom Line: This is the game for you if you want some grindhouse action with your wordprocessing tutor.

Typing of the Dead is an arcade classic, and was a major part of my childhood. I would spend countless hours at the nearby arcade typing away to kill all the zombies. I was so ecstatic to see this on steam. The game play is quite a bit more raunchy than I remember, but it's still a fun play through to kill some time.
This will give you nightmare. Don't have to much fun!!!
Windows 10 Pro 64  Game will not start. I don't even get a window. Read the negative reviews. Sega needs to fix their stuff, especially if they're going to put it on sale
